details.formulaStrippedArticleTitle: Joint estimation of Doppler centroid and rate for SAR with large range migration
details.title: Joint estimation of Doppler centroid and rate for SAR with large range migration
details.standardTitle: Joint estimation of Doppler centroid and rate for SAR with large range migration
details.abstract: For synthetic aperture radar (SAR) with large range migration, the estimation accuracy of Doppler rate may be poor without range migration correction (RMC), while inversely the correct RMC needs the accurate knowledge of Doppler parameters. By exploiting the statistical property of SAR range-Doppler domain signal, a novel Doppler parameter estimation method is proposed to solve the above dilemma. Free of a priori knowledge of platform motion including antenna beam pointing direction and flying velocity, the proposed method can realise pulse repetition frequency-ambiguity resolving, clutter-locking and auto-focusing both accurately and jointly. It is also robust to scene contrast. Experimental results based on real RADARSAT data are provided to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method.

ieee.displayText: Li-Bao Wang, Dang-Wei Wang, Jing-Jing Li, Jia Xu, Chao Xie, Ling Wang, "Ground Moving Target Detection and Imaging Using a Virtual Multichannel Scheme in HRWS Mode", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 54, pp. 5028-5043, 2016, ISSN 0196-2892.
ieee.title: Ground Moving Target Detection and Imaging Using a Virtual Multichannel Scheme in HRWS Mode

ieee.displayText: Tao Zeng, Zheng Lu, Zegang Ding, Mingming Bian, "SAR Doppler Ambiguity Resolver Based on Entropy Minimization", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 51, pp. 4405-4416, 2013, ISSN 0196-2892.
ieee.title: SAR Doppler Ambiguity Resolver Based on Entropy Minimization

ieee.displayText: Xuepan Zhang, Guisheng Liao, Shengqi Zhu, Cao Zeng, Yuxiang Shu, "Geometry-Information-Aided Efficient Radial Velocity Estimation for Moving Target Imaging and Location Based on Radon Transform", Geoscience and Remote Sensing IEEE Transactions on, vol. 53, pp. 1105-1117, 2015, ISSN 0196-2892.
ieee.title: Geometry-Information-Aided Efficient Radial Velocity Estimation for Moving Target Imaging and Location Based on Radon Transform
